title: Seattle Math Tutor - Mathematics Coursebook - Munsonmath
description:
** Munson Math Tutoring **
** Seattle Math Tutor **
** Math Tutor Seattle ** <a href="
http://www.munsonmath.com" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.munsonmath.com</a>

** A COURSE IN MATHEMATICS FOR STUDENTS 
   OF ENGINEERING AND APPLIED SCIENCE:

   INTEGRAL CALCULUS
   FUNCTIONS OF SEVERAL VARIABLES
   SPACE GEOMETRY
   DIFFERENTIAL EQUATIONS ** <a href="
http://www.munsonmath.com" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW">
http://www.munsonmath.com</a>

Bruce Munson has tutored math, chemistry and physics to university students with great success.

During extended stays in China and India, Bruce Munson tutored English as a second language to a wide variety of students young and old with good success.

Munson tutors math to students of all ages, backgrounds and abilities: adults long out of school, college students, GED candidates, and children 6 to 14 years old.

He has excellent familiarity with the curriculum and he adapts it well to the needs of the students. He establishes a good working rapport with every student and instills confidence in students who fear math and enthusiasm in those who dislike it. 

Munson speaks Chinese and Tibetan.

Bruce Munson is a graduate of Yale University and holds a BS in Civil Engineering from the University of Washington.

Mr. Munson is based in Seattle, Washington, USA.
 	 	

review of basics:
real numbers and real number operations

polynomials:
addition, multiplication and factoring polynomials

algebraic fractions:
polynomial quotients, synthetic division, complex fractions

first degree equations and inequalities in one variable:
solving equations, formulas, inequalities, absolute value

exponents, radicals and complex numbers:
integer and rational exponents, radicals, basic operations with exponents and radicals

second degree equations and inequalities:
solving quadratic equations by square roots, factoring, completing the square and the quadratic formula

graphing with equations of two variables:
slope and equation of a line, conic sections

relations and functions:
notation, graphing functions, inverse functions

exponential and logarithmic functions:
exponential and logarithmic functions and equations

systems of linear equations and inequalities:
systems in 2 and 3 variables, matrices

sequences and series:
arithmetic and geometric sequences and series


This torrent contains a PDF copy of the 1909 copy of "A Course in Mathematics" by Woods and Bailey.
